newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Two more E.Timorese held over attack on journalist.
newsitem.headline: Two more E.Timorese held over attack on journalist.

text.p: Two East Timorese have been arrested in connection with the beating of a local journalist earlier this month, police said on Tuesday, bringing to four the number so far detained over the incident.
"We have arrested two more people," East Timor deputy police chief Colonel Atok Rismanto told Reuters by telephone from Dili.
Last week, two youths were arrested in connection with the beating of Gaudensius Mau, an East Timor correspondent for the Jakarta-based magazine Tiras. The two are still being held.
Mau, who is still being treated in hospital, said he was attacked by eight youths who mistook him for an Indonesian security agent.

Many East Timorese do not accept Indonesia's rule of the province. Jakarta invaded the former Portuguese colony in 1975 before annexing it the following year in a move still not recognised by the United Nations.
Police in East Timor said it was too early to speculate on a motive for the attack.
Separately, the Jakarta Post newspaper reported on Tuesday that state prosecutors had refused to accept police evidence in the killing of a Yogyakarta-based reporter.
The reporter, known for his critical reporting of local government affairs, was beaten to death in August by an unidentified attacker.
The prosecutors said the evidence against the man suspected of killing the Bernas daily reporter was incomplete.
The National Commission on Human Rights and officials of the Indonesian Journalists' Association have questioned whether the police conducted a proper investigation.
They have said evidence suggests the man arrested by the police was not the attacker.
